TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content: As for Fregat i think it should have reaction wheels but not an actual probe core so it cant be used as an actual probe by itself.

Best of luck for results with a new cooler

As for Fregat, I have tried it for interplanetary mission, in fact deploying a probe towards Ike. The Kerbin ejection was performed by Proton upper stage. Some manouvers and landing by Fregat, not bad performance.

http://puu.sh/kGSom/2d9ac954d5.jpg

New SM texture.

In the process of stripping it down to basic components, then rebuilding a cleaner, more standard-ized texture (conforms to the style guide).

http://puu.sh/kGTNs/300b436b79.jpg

Thanks. My current temporary cooler from an i5 CPU (my i7's stock cooler kinda broke) isn't very pleasant when you want to wind down with a game that happens to want more than average CPU usage. Turns the sound of my computer into that of a tiny chainsaw, keeps driving me bananas (it's even worse when the CPU usage keeps going from like 60 to 95, agh my sanity and my ears!).

Anyway, nice mission to Ike with Fregat! Also I did come up with a few ideas in my mind as to where I'd use that engine.

EDIT: Smooth looking new SM texture!

Edited October 12, 2015 by T'Flok

New SM texture.

Hi Beale. I must say I'm not a fan of the mock-RCS thrusters in the "skirt". Since they don't have a function in KSP and since they don't reflect actual orientation of thrusters (i mean - your shading indicates their direction of thrust is towards the back, maybe at a slight angle, while Soyuz's actual thrusters there are only for pitch/yaw control, and they seem to be angled perpendicularly to the fore-aft axis), I would prefer to keep that part clean so I don't feel a need to cover them somehow...

It's a small point in any case, I just felt since you're remaking it (and it does look gorgeous) I would point it out. Not that it would make much difference for me, I rarely have time for KSP, and what little I have would be spent updating new versions of KSP and mods... still come here almost every day to see your awesome work though!

Keep it up!

Also, is there a docking port that fits in that is 2.5m? I would love that, or a very flat 1.875m to 1.25m adapter. Thanks!

EDIT: Fixed typo, needed time to launch the Buran from the Soviet conversion to fix.

Edited October 12, 2015 by legoclone09

Also liking that Soyuz CM is finally stripeless again. A welcome change IMO!
